words.definition: To advance is to go forward.
words.example: He advanced up the ladder slowly.

words.definition: An athlete is a person who plays sports.
words.example: Some athletes can run very fast.

words.definition: If something is average, it is at a normal level.
words.example: I'm not rich or poor; I'm average.

words.definition: Your behavior is the way you act.
words.example: Their behavior was very good; they were the best children in the world.

words.definition: Behind means to be at the back of something.
words.example: The little girl was hiding behind the door.

words.definition: A course is a class in school.
words.example: I took a P.E. course in school this year.

words.definition: To lower something is to make it go down.
words.example: The chart shows how his grades have lowered.

words.definition: To match is to be the same or similar.
words.example: The two shoes matched. They looked the same.

words.definition: A member is a person who is part of a group.
words.example: Only members can use the pool.

words.definition: If something is mental, it has to do with your mind.
words.example: I made a mental picture of the room.

words.definition: A passenger is a person who rides in a car, train, or airplane.
words.example: One passenger waited for the train.

words.definition: Your personality is what you are like and how you behave.
words.example: John has a bad personality.

words.definition: A poem is a short kind of writing.
words.example: William Shakespeare wrote many poems.

words.definition: A pole is a long stick made of wood or metal that stands in the ground.
words.example: The flag was hanging from the flag pole.

words.definition: To remove something is to take it away.
words.example: I removed the nail from the board.

words.definition: Safety means to be the condition of being safe and free from danger.
words.example: For safety, please help me find my zip-line belt.

words.definition: To shoot is to fire something like a bullet at someone or something.
words.example: The hunter raised his gun to shoot at the target.

words.definition: To sound means to make a noise.
words.example: The alarm clock sounded and woke me up.

words.definition: To swim is to move through water.
words.example: I love to swim in the ocean.

words.definition: A web is a home made by a spider.
words.example: Mom cleaned the spider webs out of the garage.
